Fig. 1 Rietveld refinement results for [Cd(µ-N,N′-C5H3N6)(µ-Cl)0.5(µ-N3)0.5(H2O)]n, as appreciable from calculated (top), experimental (middle) and difference (bottom) diffraction patterns. Peak markers at the bottom. Horizontal axis: 2θ, deg. Vertical axis: counts.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 2 Representation of the mono-dimensional chain present in compound 1. Interchain hydrogen bonds (dashed lines) and stacking interactions (continuous lines) are also depicted. Hydrogen atoms have been omitted for clarity purposes. Relevant bond distances, Å: Na–N 2.428(2)–2.474(2); Na–O 2.371(2); N⋯O 2.998(3), 3.003(3); intrachain Na⋯Na 6.252(2); shortest interchain Na⋯Na 3.943(2); shortest rings centroids distance 3.472(1) Å. Pmtz− torsion about the central bond, as measured by the dihedral plane between the pyrimidinic and the tetrazolate rings: 2.2(1)°.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 3 Representation, down [0 0 1], of the two-dimensional [Cd(pmtz)2]n layer present in compound 2. Hydrogen atoms have been omitted for clarity. Significant bond distances, Å: Cd–N 2.447(1), 2.536(1); intralayer Cd⋯Cd 6.4035(5); shortest interlayer Cd⋯Cd 7.8900(7). Pmtz− torsion about the central bond, as measured by the dihedral plane between the pyrimidinic and the tetrazolate rings: 0.86(9)°.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 4 Simple coordination polyheda with index N = 8 (see text). OP: octagon (planar); CU: cube; TT = triakis-tetrahedron; SAPR: square antiprism; HPY: heptagonal pyramid; DD: triangular dodecahedron; GBF: gyrobifastigium; HBPY: hexagonal bipyramid.
